channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report E-2023100870
item.description:
Report E-2023100870

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: WOODLAND
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of CS 524 Yellow M2 (UN1133) was released from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3191494 at dock door 3. The terminal advised they could clean the spill with PPE on hand, (1) 85 gallon DF contains one 55-gallon metal drum of CS 524 Yellow M2 and Oil Dri was created as waste. The waste was staged and left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100757
item.description:
Report E-2023100757

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 13, 2023, three (3) 5-gallon jugs of UN3149 were crushed during transport and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the impacted trailer, pavement, and dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. The damaged containers of product were placed into one (1) 20-gallon drum for future disposal.

  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO AND REPORTED TO DOOR 89. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR CORROSIVE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE FLOOR IN THE TRAILER. NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet package came off trailer # 819892 already damaged wet upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 4 liter glass bottles of acetonitrile 2 4 liter glass bottles had loose caps allowing .50 liters from each bottle to release package did have slotted partitions and cardboard liner on top and bottom but no bags or absorbent was found facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition DescribePack: 2 4 liter glass bottles had loose caps allowing .50 liters from each bottle to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report E-2023100791
item.description:
Report E-2023100791

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: WOODLAND
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 5 gallons of battery acid (hazardous - UN2794) was released from poly casing. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor at dock door #53 in a 6'x6' area . The terminal has requested a contractor out for cleanup and containment. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. Contractor resercured the remainder of the battery and neutralized the trailer floor with a sodium bicarb solution. Contractor advised the cells of the battery were loose and needed to be re-tightened. All waste was containerized into 1-55 gal DF to be staged on site. Waste was staged and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100782
item.description:
Report E-2023100782

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: KING OF PRUSSIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25-gallons of product released at Terminal XAY. One 55-gallon metal drum was punctured by a forklift during the offloading operations impacting a 5’ area of trailer #315-8347 and an 8’ x 6” area of the asphalt underneath the trailer. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area and then collected into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023100101
item.description:
Report X-2023100101

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment was taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Came off trailer 834754 already wet leaking and damaged from the unload at door 42. Upon inspecting the inner contents there were 2 x 2.5 gallons plastic bottles of Convo Clean Forte. The 1 x 2.5-gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .30 gallons to release. No packing was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed, contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The 1 x 2.5-gallon plastic bottle of Convo Clean Forte had a loose cap allowing .30 gallons to release and spill out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the leaking package and then was taken to the hazmat cage for further inspections on damaged hazmat.

item.title: Report X-2023081370
item.description:
Report X-2023081370

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiber board box with signs of release containing a class 8 was discovered at the MDTR facility. While investigating the fiberboard box the spill agent observed two plastic bottles with two smaller fiberboard box and bubble wrap for dunnage. One bottle had released all of its contents inside of the fiberboard box. All the contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration for movement. Shipper informed that they wanted the shipment disposed of as hazardous material.
